item.title: Piles of rubbish around Brandon rd, clapton terrace and oldhill, 29th July
item.description:
Litter everywhere from uncollected bins, flytipping and then foxes and birds tearing it apart. It’s absolutely foul around here at present

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Braydon Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Trees overhanging into garden from scadbury park, 29th July
item.description:
A complaint has already been made from number 136 Lullingstone crescent as the tree in question is overhanging into both our gardens from scadbury park. I would like the tree cut back so it doesn’t overhang into our garden. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 113, Lullingstone Crescent, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Man hole fallen through., 29th July
item.description:
Hello, It appears that a man hole or drainage lid has fallen through exposing the ground below. It has tunnels / pipes through the void and can be a safety issue for members of the public. Also is harbouring pests next to the David Lloyd Notting Hill Club.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westway, North Kensington, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is both too tall and branches hang too low, 29th July
item.description:
This tree is in desperate need of pruning. It is so high it is interfereing with cabling and the branches are so low you can't walk past it without being whacked in the face.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villiers Road, Penge, London

item.title: Unsightly and inadequate fencing around a building being renovated., 29th July
item.description:
This building, which used to house the Santini restaurant is being redeveloped . At present the frontage of the building is being fronted with an unsightly and damaged yellow mesh fencing. Can the developers be encouraged to put something in place which is less of a neighbourhood eyesore! Thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Ebury Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pavement slabs at the junction of Hadlow Road and the High Street are cracked, badly repaired and noisy when driven over. I suggest they are removed and replaced with an asphalt surface., 29th July
item.description:
The removed slabs could be used to repair the pavement in the High Street that has many unsightly repairs made of asphalt. The same issues occur at the junction of Hatherly Road and the High Street. Some of the repairs on the High Street are trip hazards as they have been done badly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Silver birch tree outside no 6 & 8 Chesham Avenue, 29th July
item.description:
The tree outside my property is causing a lot of health problems to my husband during the summer months. I have to close all my windows at the front as my husband is suffering from allergies from this tree. I spoke to my neighbour at no 8 and they also suffer from allergies from this tree and have to take 2 antihistamine tablets each day. Who’s only lived there for 2 years and has never had any allergy’s until he moved to this address.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Magpie Hall Lane, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree roots upending paving slabs outside property, 29th July
item.description:
Paving slabs are becoming more unstable due to tree roots which have been emerging over many months. In particular outside No. 23 Milestone Road -this problem has been reported previously and nothing has been done. There is a genuine trip hazard now with further root appearance alongside the garden wall which is a potential destabilizing risk to the construction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Milestone Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
